column4: has there been an update to the ethernet driver modules during the last three weeks that can have broken my installation?
does ifconfig show the statically defined address?
I just dropped connection when trying to connect to the statically defined connection. when pinging google during that connection I get destination host unreachable
can you ping 7.125.45.104
replace 7 with 74
no cigar
ok are you using a router?
as far as I've understood, the cable goes to a switch which goes to a router which then goes to the modem which then goes to our ISP
ok, can you ping the router. if the switch has an ip , can yo uping that
when pinging the router destination host is unreachable
ok then you have isolated the issue some
ok if you run: sudo lshw -C network you will see what chip your network card uses
you can then chek for drivers etc
the driver it uses is e1000e
did I kill you? :O
maybe it needs a different driver, or some options when it is porobed
perhaps. but what?
not sure, if you are using a lappy you may need to check around see what it takes
it's a thinkpad. but I'm using it as a desktop.
still a thinkpad, what model?
http://www.thinkwiki.org/wiki/Installing_Ubuntu_9.04_%28Jaunty_Jackalope%29_on_a_ThinkPad_T61
nothing about ethernet issues
i think if you install those acpi modules it'll be ok
the weird thing is that this install has lasted for months without problems
